results.title: Night cries: a rural tragedy
results.creator_credit: Tracey Moffatt, Penny McDonald and AFTRS
results.brief_description: In the red glow of the outback an Aboriginal woman nurses her ill white mother. As we watch the old woman dying her daughter confronts the finality of death; the bitterness of memory. Shot entirely in a studio “Night cries” uses a stark set-design, a palette of colours as from a dream, and a haunting soundtrack: of bush noises, gasping breath, the wail of a dingo, to suggest a world that combines the frightening distortion of a nightmare and the painful isolation of human loss. Subtitled “a rural tragedy” the film’s portrayal of a personal agony illuminates and exposes the general horror of Australia’s race history. With Marcia Langton, Agnes Hardwick and Jimmy Little.

results.title: Night children
results.creator_credit: Bernard Devlin, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of a case worker with a Children’s Aid Society and the children she helps. Working round the clock, the Society receives appeals of every sort. The film shows how the Society follows through in the case of a little girl found wandering alone on downtown streets at night and in other cases of children abandoned, uncared for, the victims of their environment.

results.title: Nigeria: giant in Africa
results.creator_credit: Ronald Dick and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This vivid recounting of Nigeria’s history, from pre-European times to the mid-20th century, provides dramatic background to the political maturing of Africa’s most populous country. Of particular interest is the film’s treatment of ancient African cultures as revealed in the three regions that make up the Federation of Nigeria.

results.title: Nigel Dick interview
results.brief_description:
Nigel Dick discusses how he moved from veterinary science to an advertising cadetship with the “Daily Telegraph”, finally moving into television in 1956 to Channel 9.
Dick talks about the early days of television in Australia; the influence of Arthur Warner, the Royal Commission into television in the 1950’s and it’s ensuing recommendations, the creation of “In Melbourne Tonight” based on the strength of Graeme Kennedy’s personality, and the response from other stations in creating a similar show for Bert Newton, or putting movies against “IMT” in the ratings.
He also discusses the relationship between print media and television, the origins of the channel 7 logo, and the future of television, including cable channels and digitisation.

results.title: Julie Stafford's taste of life : the video
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Dwyer, Chris Weir, AAV Australia and Martin and Rosenthal Pictures
results.brief_description: Best selling cookery writer Julie Stafford invites you to prepare a variety of mouth-watering recipes for breakfast, lunch, children’s meals and dinners for everyday and for special occasions. Julie also gives a brief outline of healthy foods to eat, shows how to choose and store them and gives an introduction to some common herbs. A weekly menu planner is included.

results.title: Juggling the elements
results.creator_credit: Sakshi Productions, Stewart Lodge, Tracey Power, Katrina Sawyer and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Tracey Power has maintained her courage, honesty and humour despite having suffered abuse and trauma at the hands of her family and the state from birth. Tracey looks different, she sometines has a shaved head and many tattoos and she is scarred from ‘slashing up’. Tracey acts differently, she doesn’t follow the social rules of behaviour. She loves trams and has the word ‘tram’ tattooed on her hand. She has a mental illness which has led her to being institutuionalised a number of times. She is both street wise and disarmingly trusting and generous. She looks very tough, yet she is very sensitive and vulnerable. She tells her story ‘in your face’ and she tells it ‘straight’ about abuse, institutions, drug addiction, mental illness, slashing up, giving up her baby for adoption and also about friendships, fun, love and hope. Tracey’s story tells us alot about living with mental illness, about being different and about surviving without losing your spirit or humanity.

results.title: Musicanada
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Malca Gillson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: With no commentary other than the music and words of the performers themselves, this fast-moving film presents the grandest Canadian concert of them all. Here, the performers include both the great and the unknown from across the country, the musical styles span the centuries, and the artists are involved in all stages of musicianship: learning, teaching, conducting, recording, performing. Among the film’s many stars are Edith Butler, Beau Dommage, Maureen Forrester, Glenn Gould, Paul Horn, the Huggett Family, and Gilles Vigneault. (Award: San Francisco)

results.title: Cuphead: Inspiration from the Inkwell
results.brief_description: The charming and cheeky animated characters of Studio MDHR’s Cuphead videogame spring into action in this contemporary incarnation of the popular 19th century invention, the zoetrope.

constellations_primary.name: Timeless early animation
constellations_primary.description: This Constellation traces the inspirations and evolution of the Cuphead animation technique and franchise back to the early 20th century and beyond.

results.description:
The charming and cheeky animated characters of Studio MDHR’s Cuphead videogame spring into action in this contemporary incarnation of the popular 19th-century invention, the zoetrope. Designed specifically for ACMI by Studio MDHR, this zoetrope spins and uses strobe lighting to create the illusion of 90 individual characters magically coming to life. Watch as Cuphead, Mugman, Ms Chalice, King Dice and the Devil all animate before your eyes in a series of poses representing the way Cuphead mixes classic animation with modern digital gaming.

Heavily inspired by the classic cartoons of the 1930s – particularly Fleischer Studios and Walt Disney – Studio MDHR used hand-drawn cel animation, watercolour backgrounds and original jazz recordings to create the world of Cuphead – one of the most successful run-and-gun videogames in recent memory.
description_for_label:
The charming and cheeky animated characters of Studio MDHR’s Cuphead videogame spring into action in this contemporary incarnation of the popular 19th-century invention, the zoetrope. Heavily inspired by the classic cartoons of the 1930s – particularly Fleischer Studios and Walt Disney – Studio MDHR used hand-drawn cel animation, watercolour backgrounds and original jazz recordings to create the world of Cuphead – one of the most successful run-and-gun videogames in recent memory.

results.title: Cut your home heating costs
results.creator_credit: Barbara Anson, Dave Herman, John Hoskyns-Abrahall, Jeff Cox, Auska Videobooks and Rodale Press
results.brief_description: A two part program that looks at ways to cut your home heating costs. Pt 1. How to keep the heat in your house: Looks at where the most common energy leaks around the home are and how to halt heat loss with weather stripping, caulk, insulation, and window coverings. Pt 2. Wood heat: Examines how to start heating the home with wood. How to evaluate your home’s wood heating capacity, how to select the best stove, how to get more from your fireplace and how to maintain your stove safely are all examined. NB - forms for calculating energy use, mentioned in this video are not available in Australia.

results.title: Curly Top (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Irving Cummings, Winfield Sheehan and Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Since the death of their parents, Mary Blair and her little sister Elizabeth have been inmates of a private orphanage. Mary promised her dying mother that she and Elizabeth, nicknamed “Curly Top” would never be separated. With a natural talent for singing and dancing Curly Top is a mischievous yet appealing child. Elizabeth gets into trouble during a visit of the trustees, one of them, a playboy bachelor is taken with her and decides to adopt her. The bachelor soon discovers Mary is part of the ‘deal’ and this leads to some embarrassing and often funny predicaments. Stars Shirley Temple, John Boles, Rochelle Hudson and Jane Darwell.
